intro: Vangueria bagshawei, commonly known as the yellow vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with a compact growth habit and can thrive in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
